prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame representing patient admissions:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "PatientID": ["P001", "P002", "P003", "P004", "P005", "P006"],
    "AdmissionDate": pd.to_datetime(["2025-01-10", "2025-01-12", "2025-01-15", "2025-01-18", "2025-01-20", "2025-01-22"]),
    "DischargeDate": pd.to_datetime(["2025-01-15", "2025-01-16", "2025-01-22", "2025-01-25", "2025-01-24", "2025-01-28"]),
    "Diagnosis": ["Flu", "Cold", "Flu", "Injury", "Cold", "Flu"],
    "Age": [34, 56, 23, 45, 67, 30],
    "Gender": ["Male", "Female", "Female", "Male", "Male", "Female"]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Calculate and print the average "Age" of all patients. 2) Count and print the number of patients for each "Gender". Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, calculate the average age, and count patients by gender.
